data.title: International Institute
data.text:
Featured news of the week

“Yesterday never ends” a film by Isabel Coixet “Barcelona, ​​2017. A couple meets again after five years of not seeing each other and having gone through difficult circumstances in their lives. When they feel that the past is no longer important, it suddenly returns. The not closed wounds remain always opened." Extracted from A Contracurrent

The collection in use

“My life without me” a film by Isabel Coixet “This gray existence changes completely after a medical examination. From that day on, paradoxically, Ann discovers the pleasure of living, guided by a vital impulse: to complete a list of "things to do before I die." Extracted from Filmaffinity. See also: http://www.clubcultura.com/clubcine/clubcineastas/isabelcoixet/mividasinmi/index.htm http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0314412/ http://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/ Isabel_Coixet The selected titles are

Featured news of the week

“Map of the sounds of Tokyo” directed by Isabel Coixet “The plot revolves around a frail-looking lonely young woman, Ryu, who leads a double life: at night she works at a fish market in Tokyo and sporadically receives commissions as an assassin hired. In turn, Mr. Nagara, whose daughter Midori

“To those who love” directed by Isabel Coixet [youtube=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CzSt9rC-ziE] “In the XNUMXth century, throughout one night, an old man tells the story of a great passion to a young man. The story of himself, now the Master, once the Physician, and of his silent and definitive love for Matilde. A

Cultural recommendation for the weekend

Exhibition “”From I to J. A tribute from Isabel Coixet to John Berger” “It is an exhibition and an international tribute from the filmmaker Isabel Coixet to John Berger. Based on John Berger's book From A to X, in which a woman writes letters to her imprisoned husband, Isabel Coixet creates an installation
